dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c Botha b Morkel 107 (106b 9x4 2x6 148m) SR: 100.94

dismissalComment.html: Against the run of play, Mahela falls. Moves outside leg stump, giving himself some room, but slices a full-pitched delivery on the off stump straight to point. The crowd get on their feet to applaud. The players do the same in the dressing room.

headshotImage.caption: Peter Ongondo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Peter Ongondo player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Sanath Jayasuriya player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sanath Jayasuriya player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Gotcha! Jayasuriya holes out to long leg. Quite similar to the one that he spanked for a six- again short and at the ribs, Jayasuriya swivels and short-arm pulls it straight to the man in the deep. The openers are back in the hut.

headshotImage.caption: WU Tharanga headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: WU Tharanga headshot

dismissalComment.html: Another stunner from the Africans. This time it is AB de Villiers. Short and outside off, Tharanga carves it to left of de Villiers. at point,  who takes a step and goes airborne and watches the ball sail into his cupped palms.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Yousuf player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Yousuf player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: aggression doesnt pay this time, as he comes down the track and drives one straight into the hands of mid-on inside the circle to give Ongondo his third!

headshotImage.caption: M Morkel headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: M Morkel headshot

headshotImage.caption: Virender Sehwag player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Virender Sehwag player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Stunner from Kemp at second slip. Sehwag is gone. It kicked up from short of length, on the off stump line, Sehwag tries to punch it through the line, gets an outside edge and it flies low to the right of Kemp who dives to grab it inches off the turf. The camera pans to a girl in the crowd. She is shocked. "Out aa??", she screams as her hands cover her mouth in disbelief. The crowd-puller is gone. The heat has gone up

headshotImage.caption: Steve Tikolo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Steve Tikolo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Fab doosra. Tikolo is beaten comprehensively. It landed just outside off stump, Tikolo lunges forward, dragging his feet out of the crease while playing for the one turning in but it goes the other way and Dhoni whips the bails off in time.

headshotImage.caption: Mark Boucher player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mark Boucher player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Dhoni is on a roll here! Boucher steps out in an effort to work the ball away towards square leg but fails to make contact and the ball rolls behind off the pad, Dhoni stretches across to his left, gathers the ball with his left hand and drags the ball on to the stumps. Boucher tried his best to get back in but he is just short of his crease. This is glove work at its best

headshotImage.caption: E Chigumbura headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: E Chigumbura headshot

dismissalComment.html: And then they were three. Chigumbura has a wild heave across the line, Harbhajan had slowed the pace of the delivery - doosra incidentally, and Chigumbura is through with his shot early and the ball goes on to disturb the timber.

commentTextItems.html: Asia have cleaned up the series. Full and on the stumps, Pollock backs away, drills but straight to long off. The players from both team shake hands. Mahela is out there, congratulating Rafique in particular. Celebration in the Asian camp.

commentPostTextItems.html: Dhoni butchered 139 while Mahela stitched a classy ton as Asia piled up a massive total. Africa tried gamely to chase, with Kemp peppering the long on boundary, but they fell short in the end. It was party time at Chepauk;  over 600 runs and 22 sixes were hit as the batsmen feasted. Rafique and Harbhajan shared seven wickets between them to check Africa.
Please do tune in to the England v West Indies game. That's it from me. Good bye and Good Luck.

headshotImage.longCaption: Sanath Jayasuriya player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Please whistle. That's the 22nd six of the night. Full and straight and Pollock manages to get under the ball and drills it over long on

commentPostTextItems.html: Mathew again: "Highest match aggregate at Chennai, beating the 643 scored yesterday.."
Raajesh sends us a chuckle. "next time around kemp and dhoni need DGCA permission before batting....low flying aircraft are at risk"

commentTextItems.html: low full-toss, on the middle, Botha shapes to play it across the line, gets a leading edge to cover region
yet another strangling delivery, in the blockhole length, jabbed back to the bowler
again right up there at the yorker length, driven to long off

commentPostTextItems.html: Mathew opens the Bhaji file: "Before today's game, Harbhajan had not picked up 3 wickets or more in 17 matches.

commentTextItems.html: dot ball. On the off and middle,driven abck to the bowler
Botha goes straight down the ground. Drills a fullish one past the bowler, the long on can't cut it down either.

commentTextItems.html: low full toss, on the leg side and paddled away to fine leg boundary
backs away to the leg side, Jayasuriya fires it on the leg side, tickles it to short fine leg. Fifty up for Polly.
gets a single with a drive to long on
Botha goes for the reverse sweep. Gets it past point. It has been that kind of a strange night.

driven to midwicket where the young sub , a local player, (unfortunately I can't recognise him) has a shy at the non striker's end but misses. Had it hit, there would have been a party at the young man's house.

commentTextItems.html: floated in on the middle, swept to left of Yuvraj at long leg
full, right up there at the blockhole, scooped out to long on

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura b Harbhajan Singh 4 (6b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 66.66

commentTextItems.html: And then they were three. Chigumbura has a wild heave across the line, Harbhajan had slowed the pace of the delivery - doosra incidentally, and Chigumbura is through with his shot early and the ball goes on to disturb the timber.

commentPostTextItems.html: Raghav, our scorer, points out that "All the wickets in the Asian innings were take by the pace bowlers while the spinners have cleaned up the Africans."

commentTextItems.html: full and on the legs, flicked away to Yuvraj at long leg
banged in short, Chgiumbura tries to pull, the bat meets air, the ball head to Dhoni

commentPostTextItems.html: Now Mathew turns into a tough schoomaster. "Chigumbura better make up for the 161 runs he has conceded in the last two games."

dismissalText.commentary: Virender Sehwag c Kemp b Morkel 8 (8b 2x4 0x6 12m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Stunner from Kemp at second slip. Sehwag is gone. It kicked up from short of length, on the off stump line, Sehwag tries to punch it through the line, gets an outside edge and it flies low to the right of Kemp who dives to grab it inches off the turf. The camera pans to a girl in the crowd. She is shocked. "Out aa??", she screams as her hands cover her mouth in disbelief. The crowd-puller is gone. The heat has gone up

dismissalText.commentary: Mark Boucher st †Dhoni b Harbhajan Singh 7 (10b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 70

dismissalComment.html: Dhoni is on a roll here! Boucher steps out in an effort to work the ball away towards square leg but fails to make contact and the ball rolls behind off the pad, Dhoni stretches across to his left, gathers the ball with his left hand and drags the ball on to the stumps. Boucher tried his best to get back in but he is just short of his crease. This is glove work at its best

milestones.description: Mahela Jayawardene has become the top scorer for ASIA in ODIs with 269 runs, going past Sehwag's 206
Mahela Jayawardene has scored 3 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for ASIA breaking Mohammad Yousuf's record
Shaun Pollock has scored 2 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for AFR breaking Prince's record
MS Dhoni has broken the record for most sixes (7) in ODIs for ASIA, going past Sehwag's 4
Justin Kemp has broken the record for most sixes (8) in ODIs for AFR, going past Thomas Odoyo's 2
MS Dhoni has broken the record for most sixes in an innings (5) in ODIs for ASIA, going past MS Dhoni's 2
Justin Kemp has broken the record for most sixes in an innings (7) in ODIs for AFR, going past Mark Boucher's 2
MS Dhoni has broken the record for most runs in boundaries (90) in an innings in ODIs for ASIA, going past Sangakkara's 42
MS Dhoni's 139 is the highest individual score in ODIs (for ASIA), surpassing Ganguly's 88
Justin Kemp has broken the record for most ODIs (3) as captain for AFR, going past Shaun Pollock
Mahela Jayawardene and MS Dhoni's 218-run partnership is ASIA's highest for the 6th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 33 between Mohammad Yousuf and Yuvraj Singh
Vusi Sibanda and de Villiers's 117-run partnership is AFR's highest for the 1st wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 39 between Dippenaar and de Villiers
Shaun Pollock and Justin Kemp's 122-run partnership is AFR's highest for the 6th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 84 between Mark Boucher and Prince
Mohammad Yousuf has broken the record for playing the most ODIs (7) for ASIA, going past Zaheer Khan
Dippenaar has broken the record for playing the most ODIs (6) for AFR, going past Justin Kemp
This is the highest match aggregate (649) involving teams Asia XI & Africa XI in ODIs
Asia XI's 14-run win against Africa XI is the smallest margin of victory in terms of runs in ODIs, beating 17-run win against Africa XI
Mahela Jayawardene and MS Dhoni's 218-run partnership is ASIA's highest for any wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 94 between Mohammad Yousuf and Mahela Jayawardene
Shaun Pollock and Justin Kemp's 122-run partnership is AFR's highest for any wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 103 between Thomas Odoyo and Shaun Pollock
Mahela Jayawardene and MS Dhoni's 218-run partnership is the highest for the 6th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 165 between Hussey and Brad Haddin
